insurer_name: AmTrust (arranged by Arkel Underwriting, a trading style of Arkel Limited)
coverage_summary: Multi-section insurance policy covering loss or damage to your home and its contents by insured events. Cover available for Buildings, Contents, and optional Personal Belongings sections. Coverage is restricted for unoccupied properties as shown on the Policy Schedule.
key_inclusions: Fire, smoke, explosion, lightning, earthquake damage
Storm and flood damage
Theft with forcible and violent entry/exit
Escape of water from burst pipes or tanks
Malicious acts and riot
Subsidence, heave and landslip
Collision by vehicles or animals
Falling trees, collapse of aerials or satellite dishes
Accidental damage to underground pipes and cables up to £10,000
Trace and Access for water escape up to £5,000
Alternative Accommodation up to 20% of Buildings sum insured for up to 24 months
Property Owners' Liability up to £5,000,000
Occupiers' and Public Liability up to £5,000,000
Liability to domestic staff up to £10,000,000
Accidental damage to mirrors, fixed glass to furniture and ceramic hobs up to £10,000
Contents covered on new replacement basis
Optional Accidental Damage to Buildings (including fixed glass and bathroom fittings)
Optional Accidental Damage to Contents (audio and audio visual equipment)
Optional Personal Belongings Away from Home (worldwide for up to 60 days)
Optional Specified articles and Pedal Cycles over £500
key_exclusions: Loss or damage whilst home is left unoccupied (see policy definitions and endorsements)
Faulty workmanship, defective design or use of defective materials
Theft or Attempted Theft whilst Buildings are lent, let, sub-let or occupied by anyone other than you or your family (except with forcible and violent entry/exit)
Theft where business visitors to home, unless forcible and violent entry/exit
Loss or damage or liability arising from activities of contractors
Subsidence, ground heave or landslip resulting from construction, structural alteration, repair or demolition
Malicious damage caused by you, your family, domestic staff, lodgers, paying guests or tenants, or anyone you allowed into the home
Storm, flood, subsidence, heave or landslip damage to drives, patios and paths unless home damaged at same time by same cause
Damage caused by demolition, structural alterations or structural repairs
Loss or accidental damage caused by electrical or mechanical breakdown
Wear, tear, depreciation or gradually operating cause (including wet or dry rot, rust, deterioration, cleaning)
Damage caused by Domestic Pets, Insects or Vermin
Loss or damage from failure or lack of sealant and/or grout in tiles, bath, WCs, shower basin and surrounds
Loss, damage, liability, cost or expense from infectious or contagious disease
Loss, damage, liability, cost or expense from cyber incident
Loss of or damage to electronic data
Any loss or damage which occurred prior to policy commencement
Loss, damage or liability from ownership or usage of hot tub, jacuzzi or spa unless used, maintained and serviced per manufacturer's instructions and cover securely fixed when not in use

coverage_limits.Buildings_Sum_Insured: Up to the Sum Insured chosen by customer (cost of rebuilding the property)
coverage_limits.Contents_Sum_Insured: Up to the Sum Insured chosen by customer (cost to replace all contents as new)
coverage_limits.Alternative_Accommodation: Maximum 20% of Buildings sum insured, payable for up to 24 months

sub_limits.Trace_and_Access: £5,000 to find escape of water from fixed water or heating installation
sub_limits.Accidental_Damage_Mirrors_Glass_Hobs: £10,000 for mirrors, fixed glass to furniture and ceramic hobs forming part of movable cooker
sub_limits.Personal_Belongings_Away_from_Home: Up to chosen sum insured (worldwide for up to 60 days)
sub_limits.Specified_Articles: Up to chosen sum insured (worldwide for up to 60 days)

special_conditions: Cover only provided for sections selected and shown as insured on Policy Schedule
Cover restricted for unoccupied properties as shown on Policy Schedule
If property unoccupied for more than 60 days, cover for theft, water escape, frozen pipe and malicious damage will be restricted
Pedal Cycles away from home must be adequately secured when left unattended
Hot tub, jacuzzi or spa must be used, maintained and serviced per manufacturer's instructions with cover securely fixed when not in use
You and your family must take all reasonable precautions to avoid injury, loss or damage
You must take all reasonable steps to safeguard insured property from loss or damage
Must notify insurer before starting conversions, extensions or other structural work
When claiming, must take reasonable steps to prevent further damage and attempt to recover property
excess_deductible: Standard compulsory excess: £100 (unless shown otherwise on Schedule). Subsidence, heave and landslip excess: £1,000 (unless shown otherwise on Schedule). Escape of water excess: minimum £500. Policyholders must pay excess amount for each claim.
geographical_coverage: Main private residence in England, Scotland, Wales, Northern Ireland, Isle of Man or Channel Islands. Personal Belongings: worldwide for up to 60 days (if optional cover selected)
cancellation_policy: Can cancel anytime by contacting insurance adviser. Within first 14 days: full refund if no claim made or intended. After 14 days: refund of premium less deduction for time covered and administrative costs (if no claim made). For policies issued for less than 12 months with direct debit payment: no return of premium if cancelled after 14 days.

endorsements.name: Accidental Damage to Buildings
endorsements.description: Adds accidental damage cover to Buildings including fixed glass and bathroom fittings
endorsements.coverage_impact: Extends coverage beyond named perils to accidental damage for buildings components

endorsements.name: Accidental Damage to Contents
endorsements.description: Adds accidental damage cover to audio and audio visual equipment
endorsements.coverage_impact: Extends coverage beyond named perils to accidental damage for specified electronics

endorsements.name: Personal Belongings Away from the Home - Unspecified Articles
endorsements.description: Loss or damage to belongings anywhere in the world for up to 60 days
endorsements.coverage_impact: Extends coverage to personal items outside the home up to chosen sum insured

endorsements.name: Personal Belongings Away from the Home - Specified Articles
endorsements.description: Loss or damage to belongings listed on Schedule anywhere in the world for up to 60 days
endorsements.coverage_impact: Provides higher coverage for valuable items specifically listed on schedule

endorsements.name: Specified Pedal Cycles
endorsements.description: Coverage for pedal cycles you tell us about over £500 each
endorsements.coverage_impact: Covers higher value bicycles that exceed standard limits

endorsements.name: Unoccupied Property Endorsement
endorsements.description: Special conditions applying when property unoccupied more than 60 days
endorsements.coverage_impact: Restricts cover for theft, water escape, frozen pipe and malicious damage if property unoccupied over 60 days

required_documents: Appropriate evidence requested by insurer to substantiate loss
Evidence will vary depending on nature of claim
process_steps: Contact CPA Chartered Loss Adjusters: 0117 929 9255 (9am-5pm Mon-Fri)
Provide appropriate evidence requested to substantiate loss
Take reasonable steps to prevent further damage
claims_requirements.evidence_requirements: You will be asked to provide appropriate evidence requested by insurer to substantiate your loss (specific requirements depend on claim type)

eligibility_criteria.occupational_restrictions: Must notify if home used for business purposes other than clerical
eligibility_criteria.residency_requirements: Must be main private residence of policyholder in England, Scotland, Wales, Northern Ireland, Isle of Man or Channel Islands
other_restrictions: Property must not be left unoccupied beyond stated limits
Property must be solely occupied by policyholder and family (unless letting arrangements disclosed)
Must not have undisclosed criminal convictions, police cautions or charges
Must not have undisclosed bankruptcy or bankruptcy proceedings
Must disclose if property is let, sub-let or occupied by others
Must disclose structural work, conversions or extensions before they commence

policy_definitions.Unoccupied: Refer to definitions in policy wording and any endorsements shown on Policy Schedule. Generally applies when property left empty for more than 60 days, with restrictions on theft, water escape, frozen pipe and malicious damage cover
policy_definitions.Family: Policyholder and their family members residing at the property
policy_definitions.Buildings: The structure of the property including fixed items like bathroom fittings and fixed glass
policy_definitions.Contents: Movable household items, furniture, appliances, and personal belongings
policy_definitions.Rebuilding: The cost to rebuild the property (Buildings sum insured basis)
policy_definitions.New Replacement: The cost to replace Contents as new (Contents sum insured basis)
policy_definitions.Schedule: The document showing what sections are insured, sum insured amounts, excesses, and any endorsements
policy_definitions.Forcible_and_Violent_Entry: Required for theft claims in let/sublet properties or with business visitors
policy_definitions.You/Your: The policyholder named on the schedule
policy_definitions.Excess: The amount policyholder must pay towards each claim

time_sensitive_requirements.waiting_periods: Not specified - coverage begins from start date shown on schedule
time_sensitive_requirements.notification_deadlines: Must notify insurer as soon as possible about claims and about material changes (change of address, letting property, unoccupancy over 60 days, structural work, criminal matters, bankruptcy)
time_sensitive_requirements.claims_deadlines: Claims must be notified as soon as possible
time_sensitive_requirements.cooling_off_period: 14 days from policy start - full refund available if cancelled within this period (provided no claim made or intended)

This document provides a summary of cover, exclusions and restrictions. Full terms and conditions available in policy document on request or shown on Schedule
This is an Insurance Product Information Document (IPID)
regulatory_compliance.ipid_key_info: This is a multi-section home insurance policy covering Buildings and Contents. Cover is optional and modular - only sections selected and shown on Schedule are insured. Standard excesses apply. Cover restricted for unoccupied properties. Personal Belongings can be covered worldwide for up to 60 days if optional cover selected.
regulatory_compliance.fair_treatment_obligations: Customers must give complete and accurate answers to questions. Must notify of any inaccuracies or changes before or during period of insurance. Insurer must be notified of material changes including occupancy, letting, structural work, criminal matters, bankruptcy.
regulatory_compliance.complaints_process: Contact insurance intermediary or broker for complaints (specific complaints process details to be in full policy document)
regulatory_warnings: At the beginning of the new period of insurance or when making changes to your policy, you must give complete and accurate answers to any questions you are asked relating to the insurance
You must tell your insurance adviser if you become aware of any inaccuracies or changes in the information you have provided to us, whether happening before or during the period of insurance
Failure to provide accurate information may result in claims being declined or policy being voided

common_questions.question: What happens if my property is unoccupied for more than 60 days?
common_questions.answer: Cover for losses by theft, water escape, frozen pipe and malicious damage will be restricted. Special conditions apply - refer to policy wording and endorsements on Schedule. You must notify your insurance adviser if home will be unoccupied for longer than 60 days.
common_questions.section_reference: Restrictions on cover section; What are my obligations section

common_questions.question: Am I covered for theft if I rent out a room?
common_questions.answer: Theft or Attempted Theft is NOT covered whilst Buildings are lent, let, sub-let or occupied by anyone other than you or your family, EXCEPT where there is forcible and violent entry or exit. You must notify insurer if you intend to let or sub-let your home.
common_questions.section_reference: What is not insured - Buildings and Contents sections

common_questions.question: What excess will I pay if I make a claim for subsidence?
common_questions.answer: The subsidence, heave and landslip excess is £1,000 unless shown otherwise on your Schedule.
common_questions.section_reference: Are there restrictions on cover section

common_questions.question: Can I cancel my policy and get my money back?
common_questions.answer: Yes. Within first 14 days: full refund if no claim made or intended. After 14 days: refund of premium less deduction for time covered and administrative costs (if no claim made). Note: For policies under 12 months paid by direct debit, there is no return of premium if cancelled after 14 days.
common_questions.section_reference: How do I cancel the contract section

common_questions.question: Are my belongings covered when I travel abroad?
common_questions.answer: Only if you have selected the optional Personal Belongings Away from Home cover. This provides worldwide cover for up to 60 days, either for unspecified articles up to your chosen sum insured, or for specified articles listed on your Schedule.
common_questions.section_reference: Optional Covers - Personal Belongings Away from the Home

common_questions.question: What excess do I pay for water damage claims?
common_questions.answer: The escape of water excess is a minimum of £500.
common_questions.section_reference: Are there restrictions on cover section

common_questions.question: Am I covered if I have a hot tub?
common_questions.answer: You can be covered, but only if the hot tub, jacuzzi or spa is used, maintained and serviced in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions and the cover is securely fixed in place at all times when not in use. Otherwise, any loss, damage or liability from it is excluded.

common_questions.question: Does the policy cover my bicycle?
common_questions.answer: Standard Contents cover includes pedal cycles at home. For cycles away from home, or for cycles over £500 each, you need to select the optional Specified Pedal Cycles cover. Cycles must be adequately secured when left unattended away from home.
common_questions.section_reference: Optional Covers - Personal Belongings; Are there restrictions on cover

common_questions.question: What should I do if I need to make a claim?
common_questions.answer: Contact CPA Chartered Loss Adjusters on 0117 929 9255 (9am-5pm Mon-Fri). You should take reasonable steps to prevent further damage, attempt to prevent further loss and try to recover your property. You will be asked to provide appropriate evidence to substantiate your loss.

common_questions.question: Am I covered for accidental damage?
common_questions.answer: Standard policy covers accidental damage to mirrors, fixed glass to furniture and ceramic hobs (up to £10,000), and underground pipes and cables (up to £10,000). For broader accidental damage cover, you need to select optional Accidental Damage to Buildings (including fixed glass and bathroom fittings) or Accidental Damage to Contents (audio and audio visual equipment).
common_questions.section_reference: What is insured - Buildings and Contents; Optional Covers

common_questions.question: What changes must I tell the insurer about?
common_questions.answer: You must notify as soon as possible about: change of address; intention to let or sub-let home; using home for business (other than clerical); home being unoccupied for longer than 60 days; bankruptcy or criminal matters; property no longer occupied solely by you and family. You must also notify before starting conversions, extensions or structural work.

common_questions.question: Is wear and tear covered?
common_questions.answer: No. Wear, tear, depreciation or any gradually operating cause is excluded, including but not limited to wet or dry rot, rust, deterioration or damage from cleaning.
